content.question:
<math alttext="The figure shows a 5 column table with 1 row of data. The data are as follows. x is 2; f of x is 5; f prime of x is 3; g of x is 2; and g prime of x is 4." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid solid solid solid none" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid none"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mi>g</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd><mtd><msup><mi>g</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
The table shown gives values of the differentiable functions <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and their derivatives at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="h of x equals the fraction f of x, over g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="h prime of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?
